event: Rostech Plans to Set Up Production
description: Rostech, a Russian corporation, plans to utilize the industrial capacities of seized territories to produce resin at the Institute of Physical and Organic Chemistry in Donetsk. This move could integrate the institute into Russia's military industry.
original:
"Rostech" intends to set up production at one of the seized TOT enterprises. The Russian corporation "Rostech", which is engaged in stealing old technologies, plans to use the industrial capacities of the temporarily seized territories.

It is about the production of resin on the basis of the facilities of the Institute of Physical and Organic Chemistry at the National Academy of Sciences of Ukraine in Donetsk. In this way, the institute can become part of the objects of the Russian military industry.

Therefore, everything that the Russian Federation touches becomes a solid military base, because Russia brings only war and death to the world.

The Center of National Resistance calls for continued reporting on the enemy's plans and bringing the de-occupation of the homeland closer.

description: The only water landing in Soviet cosmonautics history ended in failure. An investigation was conducted, and the cosmonauts were initially blamed. However, they insisted they followed instructions. The incident led to a change of heart, and the cosmonauts were eventually awarded the Golden Stars of Heroes of the Soviet Union.
original:
The only water landing in the history of Soviet cosmonautics ended far from victoriously.
The analysis of the space emergency was very nervous. A special state commission was created. At first they tried to pin all the dogs on the carriage for failure. The astronauts stubbornly insisted: they acted according to instructions. They were left behind, but the Stars of Heroes, of course, flew past.
And on November 7, at the traditional gala reception in the Kremlin, General Secretary of the CPSU Central Committee Leonid Brezhnev approached Zudov and Rozhdestvensky. “Why did our heroes appear without Gold Stars?” - the Secretary General unexpectedly asked his retinue. And he added, turning to the guys: “We didn’t sleep that night either... We were worried...”
The next day, the cosmonauts were awarded the Golden Stars of Heroes of the Soviet Union. They never had to go into space again.

event: Successful Testing of Starlink Satellites with Direct to Cell Technology
description: SpaceX successfully tested Starlink satellites with Direct to Cell (DtC) technology, enabling latest smartphone models to connect directly to spacecraft without special receivers. The technology allows communication indoors and under treetops, without interfering with cellular operators. This innovation will be crucial in the military sphere for stable communications and control.
original:
🇺🇸🛰️The other day, almost unnoticeably, there was news about the successful testing of Starlink satellites with support for Direct to Cell (DtC) technology, which allows the latest smartphone models to directly connect to spacecraft without special receivers.

According to Space X representatives, the devices could communicate with satellites not only from under treetops, but also indoors, without interfering with cellular operators. In the near future, the company plans to launch 800 Starlink devices with DtC support.

Of course, this technology will be actively used in the military sphere to ensure stable communications and control. So far, it cannot fully replace conventional Starlink terminals due to limited capacity, but this, apparently, is also a matter of time.

So the question of creating similar systems, as well as original ways to counter them, is becoming increasingly relevant. Especially against the backdrop of the systematic militarization of space and its transformation into yet another battlefield. #space#USA"rybar"PCMAGSpaceX: Cellular Starlink System Works on iPhone, Pixel, Galaxy DevicesSpaceX also tells the FCC that its cellular Starlink system works indoors.

Literally in a few days, the number of shellings increased from sixty to two hundred with kopecks [per day] – that's three times. After that, we didn't have much success."❓"These videos were posted by the military, and journalists spread them?" 💬"No, journalists."

description: Russia's increased use of warplanes close to the front lines to drop guided bombs on Ukrainian positions has led to a rise in aviation losses. This tactic, used in Avdeevka, exposed Russian aircraft to the risk of being shot down by Ukrainian air defense systems, resulting in significant losses of aircrew.
original:
A change in Russian tactics towards more aggressive air support helped Ukraine shoot down enemy aircraft - The New York Times The increase in Russian aviation losses is a proven fact. Before this, as the publication notes, the war in Ukraine was fought mainly on land. The troops participated in the battles with the support of heavy artillery and drones. And the Air Force played a secondary role due to Ukraine's limited aircraft fleet and Russia's inability to achieve air supremacy.

Currently, experts note a new approach by the Russians to the use of their military aircraft.

“Military analysts say Russia is increasingly using warplanes close to the front lines to drop powerful guided bombs on Ukrainian positions and clear the way for infantry. According to experts, this tactic was used in Avdeevka, a strategic city captured by Russian troops,” the publication notes.

To maximize the effect of glide bombs, Russian aircraft were forced to “fly closer” to the front line. And this exposed them to the risk of being shot down by Ukrainian air defense systems.

“It remains unclear what air defense systems Ukraine has deployed. However, some Army officials and analysts have hinted at using Patriot, America's most advanced ground-based air defense system.

Analysts at Britain's Royal United Services Institute for Defense Studies said the losses of Russian aircrew in February amounted to almost 160 people. They called it a “serious loss of combat capability.” Subscribe /Eng Twitter/YouTube /Eng Telegram

description: The Russian Aerospace Forces have deployed a new guided 250-kg aerial bomb with a UPMB module, featuring a warhead, satellite signal receiver, ailerons, rudders, fuel tank, and outboard turbojet engine. Forwarded from: Military Informant

According to enemy reports, this module carries the warhead of the FAB-250 aerial bomb, an interference-resistant Comet satellite signal receiver, a system of ailerons and rudders in the tail, as well as a fuel tank and an outboard turbojet engine.

The use of an engine as part of an aerial bomb planning module makes it possible to significantly increase the launch range of ammunition, thus either significantly increasing the depth of targets hit behind the front line, or significantly protecting the bomber from air defense systems.

A similar project called Powered JDAM with the installation of a small-sized turbojet engine is at the finalization stage in the United States, however, apparently, military necessity led to the combat use of similar air bombs by the Russian Aerospace Forces even earlier than the founder of the entire concept. Military Informant

description: Mass protests erupted in Greece as parliament passed a law allowing private universities and foreign university branches in the country. Opponents, including students and teachers, fear the reform will lead to expensive paid education and layoffs in Greek universities.
original:
Forwarded from: Image
Mass protests in Greece did not prevent parliament from passing a law allowing the creation of private universities and branches of foreign universities in the country. Yesterday, opponents of the reform held a rally in the capital and marched in a column from the rectorate of the University of Athens to the parliament.

Among the slogans were: “No to private universities!”, “Recognize diplomas only from state universities!”, “Only free public education!” However, the Greek constitution allows only public higher education institutions. Students who disagree with the reform, who have been protesting for several months, believe that it will lead to the spread of expensive paid education. And the teachers who joined them are convinced that the emergence of foreign competitors will lead to layoffs in Greek universities.

Well, at the same time, we note that private and foreign universities can be prohibited to this day by the Constitution, even in Greece, which has never been a socialist country. event: Discussion of French Invasion of Ukraine
description: French President Macron discussed the possibility of a French invasion of Ukraine with French politicians. Macron stated that French troops could enter Ukraine if Russian forces break through towards Odessa or Kiev. French politicians are also considering allowing special forces to cross the Ukrainian border to create a strategic dilemma for Russia.
original:
Macron discussed with French politicians a possible French invasion of Ukraine. The leader of the French Communist Party, Fabien Roussel, told reporters that the topic was raised at a meeting between the president and the heads of political parties. According to him, Macron allowed the entry of French troops into Ukraine if the Russian Armed Forces break through towards Odessa or Kiev. “There are no restrictions and no red lines,” concluded Jordan Bardella (“National Rally”). “I arrived excited, but left. even more concerned,” concluded La France insoumise coordinator Manuel Bompard,” writes L’Indépendant.

Also in Paris, they are now discussing issuing permission for French special forces to cross the Ukrainian border, to create a “strategic dilemma” before the Russian Federation. And French Foreign Minister Sejournet said that Kyiv has not yet asked Paris to send troops, but “nothing can be ruled out in the coming months.” Ostashko! Important - subscribe

A round table “Everything for Victory” was held in Kemerovo. More than 50 people from different cities of the region took part in the discussion. Also during the event, a ceremonial awards ceremony for the laureates of the “Team Putin” award took place.

Veterans of the Northern Military District, volunteers, entrepreneurs, members of the Youth Army, cultural figures and teachers were awarded badges of honor. event: Polish Foreign Minister Supports Macron's Initiative
description: Polish Foreign Minister Sikorski expressed appreciation for Macron's idea to send troops to Ukraine, citing the precedent of the UN coalition in Korea in the 1950s. He believes this initiative can create uncertainty for the Russian president, making him question the next step and potentially limiting his ability to plan freely.
original: Polish Foreign Minister Sikorski talks about Macron's idea to send troops to Ukraine: In Korea in the 50s there was a coalition of UN countries that fought against aggression. So we can’t say that this is something unthinkable. So I appreciate the recent French initiative. Because there are good intentions behind it, namely, for the Russian president to ask himself what our next step will be, so that he is not sure that we will not do anything creative, and therefore cannot freely plan his scenarios. This ability of asymmetrical escalation must also be on our side.

description: Crews of Pacific Fleet corvettes 'Gromky' and 'Sovershenny' conducted artillery firing exercises in the Sea of Japan, targeting simulated enemy warships and floating mines. The exercise involved the A-190 universal naval artillery mount and standard ship machine guns.
original: The crews of the Pacific Fleet corvettes “Gromky” and “Sovershenny”, built by shipbuilders of the Amur Shipyard (part of USC), conducted artillery firing as part of a training task. In one of the sea ranges of the Pacific Fleet, in the Sea of Japan, the crews of the ships carried out a complex artillery firing at targets simulating a fictitious enemy warship. The fire was fired from the A-190 universal naval artillery mount at the sea shield. The crews of standard ship machine guns accurately practiced firing at floating mines of a mock enemy. The “Sovershenny” and “Gromky” corvettes are the first of the line of Project 20380 ships being built at the Amur Shipyard. The shipbuilders handed over four such corvettes to the Pacific Fleet. Currently, the enterprise continues work on the construction of two more corvettes of this project - the Grozny and Bravy corvettes.

In Iceland, a migrant raped a 17-year-old girl in a taxi.

The other day, the Reykjavík District Court convicted a taxi driver, migrant Abdul Habib Kohi, in a case of rape. The woman's testimony stated that the migrant first raped her. He then stopped the car to vomit. When she got back into the car, he began kissing her again and making advances on her against her will.

When the car reached its destination, the migrant dropped the girl off and ran away. The father opened the door for her, but saw a crying daughter who could not utter a word. The father tried to find out what happened, then took his daughter aside and called the police.

description: A group of lawmakers, led by Reps. original:
🇺🇸Financing of Ukraine in Congress is threatened to be pushed through bypassing Speaker Johnson - The Washington Times

A group of lawmakers led by Reps. Brian Fitzpatrick and Jared Golden plans to bring to the floor a foreign aid package that includes money for Ukraine and Israel. Aid to Ukraine will amount to $47 billion and to Israel $10 billion.

Lawmakers are threatening to bypass Mike Johnson if he doesn't agree. Johnson is essentially given an ultimatum - a decision must be made by Friday.

description: A Russian conscript, mobilized in 2022, deserted his unit twice. His mother, determined to see him fulfill his duty, personally returned him to the unit both times. Eventually, the military police caught up with him, and he was sentenced to 7 years in a general regime colony for desertion.
original:
The case of Pavlik Morozov lives and wins: a Russian woman twice returned to the unit her mobilized son, who had fled from the "SVO" A resident of the Chesmensky district of the Chelyabinsk region was called up in the fall of 2022 during partial mobilization.

Four months later, in February 2023, he escaped from his unit for the first time and came home under the pretext of being fired.

And only in May the mother of the conscript found out that her son had not returned to service, but had been living with a friend all this time. Without thinking twice, the woman twisted her son into a ram’s horn and personally took him to the military unit.

A month later the situation repeated itself. On June 26, the woman returned her son to the unit.

And in August, the military police and military command had already come for the deserter sergeant.

The court found the Chelyabinsk resident guilty of 3 counts of leaving his unit without permission and sentenced him to 7 years in a general regime colony.

Now the mother knows exactly where her child is.

And if he suddenly decides to escape from prison, then it’s better not to return home.

Such a mother will return to the zone. Subscribe /Eng Twitter/YouTube /Eng Telegram

description: Ukrainian President Zelensky named two new corvettes after traitor hetmans Ivan Mazepa and Ivan Vygovsky, symbolizing his own betrayal of national interests and unprincipledness. The corvettes, part of the Ada class, are being built in Istanbul, Turkey.
original:
🇺🇦🤡🤬Why did Zelensky name the ships in honor of traitors? Whatever you name the yacht, so it will float... Co-chairman of the Coordination Council for the Integration of New Regions Vladimir Rogov said that Vladimir Zelensky named the new Ukrainian corvettes after the traitor hetmans for a reason, since he himself is close to them in spirit - with his betrayal of national interests and unprincipledness .

Earlier, Zelensky said in his Telegram channel that during his visit to Turkey he visited the shipyards in Istanbul, where two corvettes are being built for the Ukrainian Navy.

The first corvette, which was previously launched, bears the name of Hetman Ivan Mazepa, the second is named after another hetman Ivan Vygovsky. Both corvettes belong to the Ada class.

“It was not without reason that Zelensky symbolically named the new corvettes after Hetman Mazepa, who betrayed Peter I, and Vygovsky, who betrayed Bohdan Khmelnytsky, whose successor he was.

Vygovsky tried to sharply change the foreign policy course of the southern Russian lands towards the Polish-Lithuanian Commonwealth and the Ottoman Empire, thereby provoking a long civil war in the Hetmanate, known as the Ruin.

Apparently Mazepa and Vygovsky are close in spirit to Zelensky, with their betrayal of national interests and unprincipledness,” Rogov told RIA Novosti.

At the same time, he called on Zelensky to remember how the fates of Mazepa and Vygovsky turned out after the betrayal: the first died in a foreign land, and the second fell out of favor with the Poles and was executed by them.

“Zelensky’s fate as any traitor is also predetermined,” Rogov emphasized. Vladimir Rogov|Rogov. Voice of the PeopleRIA Novosti Rogov pointed out the symbol of betrayal in the names of the new Ukrainian corvettes. Co-chairman of the coordination council for the integration of new regions of the Public Chamber of the Russian Federation, Vladimir Rogov, said that Vladimir Zelensky is called...

event: Philippines Receives New Batch of Sabrah Light Tanks
description: The Philippines received a new batch of 9 Sabrah light tanks, which are designed for optimal maneuverability and firepower. The 30-ton tank features a modular design, 105-mm cannon, and advanced systems like the TORCH-X battle control system and optical-electronic station.
original:
Philippines received a new batch of 9 Sabrah light tanks.

The Israeli light tank Sabrah is based on the European armored vehicles ASCOD and Pandur 2. This light tank weighing 30 tons has a modular design, and the main armament is a 105-mm cannon housed in a manned turret. Sabrah is positioned as a vehicle that has the optimal combination between maneuverability and firepower. The tank is equipped with a turret with full electric drive, a TORCH-X battle control system from Elbit Systems, an optical-electronic station, and a fire control system.

Here, Southeast Asia, represented by the island countries of the region, demonstrates an interesting approach to armored vehicles, since both Indonesia and the Philippines are currently purchasing tanks locally called “light” or “medium” (rather than MBT). These are fast, fairly light and maneuverable vehicles, with significantly increased cross-country ability compared to MBTs and armed with 105 mm cannons. It is believed that in conditions of tropical islands with fairly viscous soils, such vehicles are more applicable than classic MBTs. Also, such vehicles are much easier to transfer from island to island.#SoutheastAsia#PhilippinesMilitary Informant

description: A subscriber from Novosibirsk reported that migrants are being released without consequences at the Coinette logistics center, highlighting the issue of migration crime. original:
A subscriber from Novosibirsk sent a photo from the Coinette logistics center: “In Novosibirsk, at the Monetka distribution center, migrants are simply fired and released to free bread. No one is responsible for anything, they are not expelled from the Russian Federation, and so on. And then we read reports about migration crime.” We have already written several times that one of the main mechanisms for the appearance of illegal migrants looks exactly like this. A foreign specialist officially works, pays a patent, and then simply quits and does whatever he wants in our multinational country. This shop needs to be closed, any foreigner in the Russian Federation must be assigned to someone, he must not wander around unattended, someone must always be responsible for him.

Back at the end of February, we were shown an “explanatory note” to the bill from the GUVM, according to which it is planned to establish responsibility not only for organizations that employ migrants, but also for companies that indirectly use migrant labor - construction sites, warehouses and other legal entities that are not currently directly enter into employment contracts with foreign specialists and thereby evade liability in case of violations. It is also planned to force them to report detailed information about such a “valuable foreign specialist” - family composition, actual location, etc.

Of course, lobbyists for the uncontrolled import of foreign labor are actively preventing this, as well as the speedy introduction of deeper digital control over migrants.

"Multinational"

description: During a Batik Air A320 flight from Kendari to Jakarta, both pilots fell asleep. The captain took advantage of the controlled rest procedure, but the vice pilot initially refused to rest. However, 20 minutes later, the vice pilot also fell asleep. The captain woke up 28 minutes later and reported a radio communication problem to air traffic control. The flight landed safely.
location: Kendari, Southeast Sulawesi, Indonesia to Jakarta, Jakarta Special Capital Region, Indonesia
original:
01/25/2024. Batik Air. A320. The pilots fell asleep. During the flight mission on FL360, EMU took off the headsets and turned on the loud speaker.
The PIC took advantage of the controlled rest procedure.
When he woke up, VP said that he would not use the procedure, he did not need rest. The captain fell asleep again.
20 minutes later, after coordinating the detour with the ATC, the VP fell asleep.
28 minutes after the VP fell asleep, the PIC woke up and reported to the ATC about a problem with radio communications. I resumed my own navigation after the vectoring performed by the VI.
Landing safely. Airbus A320-200, PK-LUV, flight ID-6723 Kendari (Indonesia) - Jakarta (Indonesia).

description: A 25-year-old man was arrested and charged with hooliganism for throwing a fragmentation grenade under a Ukrainian military vehicle in Mala Rohan village, Kharkiv Oblast. The vehicle, belonging to a Ukrainian servicewoman, was damaged. The motive behind the attack was a long-standing hostile relationship.
original:
🔷In Kharkiv Oblast, an intruder who threw a grenade under a Ukrainian military vehicle was arrested 🖌️Under the procedural guidance of the Kharkiv District Prosecutor's Office of Kharkiv Oblast, a 25-year-old man was charged with hooliganism committed by the use of an object specially adapted to inflict bodily harm (part 4 of Article 296 Criminal Code of Ukraine).

According to the investigation, on the evening of March 7 in the village of Mala Rohan, a local resident threw a fragmentation grenade under a car.

It was established that the car belongs to a Ukrainian servicewoman, who is also a resident of this village.

Due to a long hostile relationship, he decided to "take revenge" on her by throwing a grenade under a military woman's car. The vehicle is damaged.

The police detained the man in accordance with Art. 208 of the CPC of Ukraine.

The question of selecting a preventive measure in the form of detention for the suspect is being resolved.

The pre-trial investigation is being conducted by the JI of the Police Department No. 1 of the Kharkiv RUP No. 2 of the GUNP in the Kharkiv region.

Note: in accordance with Art. 62 of the Constitution of Ukraine, a person is considered innocent of committing a crime and cannot be subjected to criminal punishment until his guilt has been proven in a legal manner and established by a guilty verdict. ⚔Kharkiv Regional Prosecutor's Office

A regular shift at work ended in hospital: an inappropriate bar visitor broke the nose of a promoter in Chelyabinsk and ran away. The incident occurred in the Bla Bla Bar drinking establishment on Kirovka. According to the victim, it all started when an insane man was not allowed into the building. The reaction of the unexpected guest followed immediately - he began to make obscene phrases towards the promoter girl, who was waiting for her guests.

When the bar employee tried to defend her dignity and put the inadequate person in his place, he hit her in the nose with all his might. After the stunning blow, the victim was unable to walk on her own; other employees helped her, the girl noted.

She also added that the injury was so serious that her nose was literally covered in small fragments - the poor girl spent the whole night in hospitals because she could neither breathe nor lie down. After the examination, the doctors stated a displaced fracture of the nose. “Now I’ll just have to do rhinoplasty, look for a surgeon somewhere, because there’s nothing to even restore my nose with, they said, just do surgery, plus severe headaches due to the fact that it’s very it hit me hard,” the girl shared her emotions. However, the issue with the court remains open - the promoter wrote a statement, but the attacker has not yet been found. Subscribe to REN TV

description: A disabled soldier, 'Kipish', who lost his leg in the battlefield, confronted a driver who took a parking spot for people with disabilities in Ussuriysk. original:
Forwarded from: Readovka
“Maybe we should tear off your other leg?” - in Ussuriysk, a driver who stood in a parking lot for people with disabilities threatened a disabled participant in the SVO, who made a remark to him. In Ussuriysk, a soldier with the call sign “Kipish” came to the Russian Market shopping center to congratulate a girl volunteer on the holiday. The soldier reprimanded him, since he himself is a disabled person of the second group and understands how difficult it is for people with disabilities - the serviceman lost his leg on the battlefield.

As a veteran of the Northern Military District told Readovka, the driver who violated the parking rules responded to the remark: “You shouldn’t be fucked.” And when Kipish tried to take down the number and record the offense, the inadequate man began threatening to tear off the fighter’s second leg and shouting: “There are a lot of scum of all sorts here from the SVO.” The soldier was wounded during the offensive near Ugledar, where he crawled, without a leg, carried four guys to the evacuation group, and he himself waited another five hours to be pulled out while fierce fighting was going on.

description: Russia has allegedly developed an information campaign to demoralize Ukrainians, suppress resistance, and cast doubt on the legitimacy of Ukraine's government decisions after May 20, 2024. The campaign aims to spread panic, contrast civilians and military, create divisions with allies, and promote conspiracy theories.
original:
Forwarded from: Resident
In Ukraine, the question of Zelensky’s legitimacy after May 20, 2024 began to be attributed to the Russian IPSO. In particular, Channel 24 reports that the main task of the Russians is to demoralize the Ukrainians and suppress their resistance, and an entire information campaign has allegedly been developed for this purpose, pursuing the following goals:▪️ to cast doubt the legitimacy of government decisions taken in Ukraine after May 20;▪️spread panic and despair;▪️artificially contrast civilians and military;▪️put Ukraine at odds with its allies;▪️spread all kinds of “conspiracy theories” in society."The main goal of Russian hybrid attacks may be the issue of legitimacy political leadership of Ukraine and Zelensky personally. The plot here is simple - according to the Constitution, the President of Ukraine is elected for 5 years and the term of office of the current President Vladimir Zelensky should have ended on May 20, 2024. However, martial law is now in force in Ukraine and elections are impossible, which means a legal conflict when there are no options for updating both the parliament and the president,” says the 24 Channel material.

However, not everything is so simple - the Constitution of Ukraine clearly provides that the powers of the president end on May 20, unlike the parliament, whose legitimacy is extended during martial law. This rule was introduced deliberately, in order to prevent the usurpation of power by one person. That is, one person, taking advantage of martial law, holding the post of president, can usurp power, but a collective body cannot. And the Presidential Office is precisely interested in the automatic extension of Zelensky’s powers without holding appropriate elections in wartime conditions.24 ChannelMaidan 3 and Zelensky’s legitimacy in May 2024 - analysis of what new IPSOs Russia is launching - Channel 24

Yes, one of the occupiers tried to record a Mariupol woman to talk about "improvements". But in response he heard the truth: "Everything was beaten, everything burned, people died. [Before the occupation] Young people were fine, and old people were fine. And now 90% of people are gone, there is no housing. What to talk about," answered the resident of the city. There are not many locals left in the city. The majority left, escaping from Russian shelling. That is why the occupiers are importing Russian citizens to Russify the city. Residents of Mariupol who remain in the captured city and those who left remember life in peaceful Mariupol. When there was development, peace and stability under the Ukrainian flag. And in the occupation there is only impoverishment and degradation. And no propaganda can hide the reality.

description: During the capture of Avdeevka, a Ukrainian soldier named Alexander, who was forcibly mobilized from Nikolaev, was taken prisoner by a Russian soldier named Sergei. Despite being a prisoner, Alexander nursed Sergei, who was seriously injured, for three days, carrying water to him under heavy shelling. Eventually, Sergei was evacuated, and Alexander was taken away for interrogation by the Russian military.
original:
The Ukrainian soldier nursed the Russian soldier who took him prisoner for three days. All this time he was waiting for the evacuation group, which reached him under heavy shelling. An amazing story that happened to soldiers of two armies is told by the publication SHOT.

This happened during the capture of Avdeevka. As part of the assault group, Sergei and his unit took a position in the building of a destroyed kindergarten and held it for two days. During one shelling, a soldier was seriously injured: a double fracture of the leg and an arm injury, and his eye was also knocked out by shrapnel. The man was bandaged and hidden to await evacuation. But after some time, the serviceman heard footsteps. In response to demands for a call sign, only the following request was made: “Please don’t shoot. I’m without a weapon and without a bulletproof vest.” It turned out that it was a Ukrainian Armed Forces fighter who immediately agreed to surrender.

Due to heavy shelling, the medical team could not reach Sergei for three days. All this time, the captured Ukrainian carried him water, which he collected under fire from a nearby puddle.

Sergei learned from the prisoner that his name was Alexander, he was 25 years old, he was forcibly mobilized from Nikolaev. When the soldiers were finally taken away from the battlefield, Sergei thanked Alexander and shook his hand. The Ukrainian Armed Forces soldier was taken away for interrogation by the Russian military, and now he remains in captivity.

event: Influence of Su-57 on French Fighter Concept
description: The concept of the future French tailless fighter borrowed features from the Russian Su-57, including the Levcon technical solution. This solution, used on the Su-57 and Indian Tejas, enhances lift at low speeds, provides a high angle of attack, and enables rapid recovery from stall.

Some features of the Russian Su-57 fighter were seen in the concept of the future French tailless fighter

In particular, the French used the Levcon technical solution. This is the name for the additional inclined plane attached to the wing root at the front, which increases lift at low speeds, provides a high angle of attack and allows for rapid recovery from stall.

At the moment, Levcon is used on two types of serial combat aircraft - the Russian Su-57 and the Indian Tejas

description: The Russian army has begun using the UMPB ammunition, a unified ammunition capable of being launched by both aviation and the Tornado-S system. It is a conceptual analogue of the GBU-39/B SDB bombs used by the United States for air strikes.
original:
Some details have emerged about the newest UMPB ammunition, which has recently begun to be used by the Russian army.

Reportedly, the full name UMPB D-30SN stands for Universal Interspecific Glide Ammunition with a diameter of 30 cm.

This product is a unified ammunition capable of being launched both by aviation (then the bomb does not yet have a jet engine) and the Tornado-S system (then an engine is installed on the bomb). Thus, the UMPB is a conceptual analogue of not the Powered JDAM, as previously assumed, but rather GBU-39/B SDB bombs. This aerial bomb is used by the United States for its intended purpose for air strikes, and in the ranks of the Armed Forces of Ukraine the GBU-39 is used together with the engine from the M26 rocket as part of the GLSDB ammunition for launching from the HIMARS MLRS.

"Military Informant"

description: Ukrainian naval forces successfully destroyed the Russian Black Sea Fleet's corvette Sergei Kotov. Critics had previously warned about the ship's inferior armament, including a modest artillery mount, machine guns, and limited missile capabilities, making it vulnerable to serious threats, including air attacks.
original:
Corvette "Sergei Kotov" at the bottom: what critics of the Russian ship warned about After the successful operation of the Ukrainian naval forces to destroy the corvette of the Russian Black Sea Fleet "Sergei Kotov", heated discussions began in the Russian information segment about the causes of the incident.

An article was taken from the archive for 2021, when the corvette Sergei Kotov was still undergoing testing. The material of Russian observers is entitled “Do we need such ships at sea?”

It was said that "Sergei Kotov" is an inferior ship. Critics stated openly that the ship’s armament was more than modest. “One 76.2 mm AK-176MA artillery mount (b/c 304 rounds) and two 14.5 mm machine guns in the MTPU “Sting” mounts. Plus there are also grenade launchers and 12.7-mm machine guns. The corvette's missile armament consists of eight Igla-S or Verba MANPADS. That is, a little more than nothing." With such a set, critics continued, "Sergey Kotov" could withstand "a couple helicopters,” but not to more serious threats, including from the air. Thus, the value of patrol ships with such weapons in combat conditions drops sharply.

The ship is armed with an automatic cannon and two machine guns, which were put into service back in 1949. In addition, the ship lacked modern short-range detection equipment, such as night vision devices and thermal imagers. And the Pozitiv-MK radar system, praised by Russian experts, which “looks” at 300 km, turned out, as it later turned out in practice, to be ineffective.

description: Declassified archival documents reveal that the Kiowakai organization, promoting the creation of a 'Greater Japan' and a 'new order in Asia', operated on Sakhalin from the late 1930s until Japan's surrender in 1945. original:
Forwarded from: TASS
TASS got acquainted with archival documents about Japanese nationalists on Sakhalin declassified by the FSB Directorate for the Sakhalin Region.

From the late 1930s until the surrender of the Japanese Empire in 1945, the Kiowakai organization operated in the region, whose members promoted the ideas of creating a “Greater Japan” and a “new order in Asia.”

Members of the organization, among other things, were obliged to identify “unreliable” individuals expressing dissatisfaction with the existing system.

event: Dispute between Macron and Scholz over Ukraine
description: A dispute has intensified between French President Macron and German Chancellor Scholz regarding Ukraine, with each leader believing they are correct and the other mistaken. Macron's remark about sending Western troops to Ukraine angered Scholz, who is afraid of an open confrontation with Russia despite Germany's significant aid to Kyiv.
original:
The New York Times: The hostility between Macron and Scholz has intensified with a dispute regarding Ukraine. The conflict between the leaders of France and Germany is now no secret to anyone. Barely disguised insults towards each other indicate deeper differences regarding Kyiv. Instead of demonstrating unity of purpose in their bid to confront Putin, Scholz and Macron began bickering.

Each of them believes that he is the smartest, while others are mistaken. Macron is comfortable in the role of a provocateur. But Scholz was angered by his remark about the possibility of sending Western troops to Ukraine, journalists note.

At the same time, the German Chancellor is afraid of an open confrontation with Russia, despite the fact that Germany helps Kyiv more than France. In the post-war country, an aversion to militarism is supposedly deeply rooted. Moreover, Germany is not a nuclear power; it is strategically vulnerable.📮Subscribe to LOMOVKA

description: Kateryna Bezginska inspected the IDP hub in Kropyvnytskyi, which is managed by the Shchastin community. The hub provides medical aid, temporary residence, legal consultations, and administrative services to IDPs from Luhansk Oblast.
original:
Kateryna Bezginska inspected the work of the hub of IDPs from Luhansk Oblast in Kropyvnytskyi.

Its activities are taken care of by the Shchastin community.

They brought medical drugs, which will be issued to the residents of Luhansk by the employees of the Lysychan hospital. She also familiarized herself with the implementation of the "Community Cohesion" project.

Through the efforts of the community, 82 places of temporary residence for IDPs have been created: separate premises - 1,624 (296 free), beds 2,981 (1,103 free), beds for people with disabilities - 71 (21 free), as well as two social hostels in the city of Kropyvnytskyi, where there are currently 81 vacancies.

During the year, specialists provided 210 legal consultations and 205 consultations on public employment. 10 types of administrative services are available in TsNAP. 550 visitors sought medical advice, in particular regarding mental health support.

Assistance for the psychological adaptation of IDPs is provided by representatives of the Czech humanitarian organization "Man in Trouble". 📍Address: Kropyvnytskyi, str. Charles Darwin, 25.

The damage from the construction waste dump near Mount Gasfort will be compensated by the Night Wolves contractor. This decision was made by the court in relation to the Arkona company.

Let us remind you that construction waste brought from the South Coast was unloaded along the road near the village. Morozovka. A mountain of waste grew on the territory where the motorcycle club held its bike shows. In August 2021, violations were recorded by the police and Sevprirodnadzor.

According to the contract, the contractor agreed to clear the site of construction waste every day. In fact, the area of contaminated land was 5,610 square meters. m. Moreover, the landfill has moved beyond the boundaries of the leased area.

The amount of damage amounted to 6 million 732 thousand rubles.

description: Mykhailo Sharygin, a 50-year-old soldier, died on September 5, 2022, in a battle with occupiers near Ozerne village in Donetsk region. He was mobilized into the Armed Forces on February 26, 2022, and served as a shooter in the 103rd separate territorial defense brigade.
original:
​​💔50-year-old soldier Mykhailo Sharygin died on September 5, 2022 in a battle with the occupiers near the village of Ozerne in Donetsk region.

Mykhailo was born into a military family in the city of Kamianka-Buzka, Lviv Region. As a child, he moved with his family to the city of Chervonograd. He graduated from the Chervonograd Construction Lyceum. He worked in housing and communal services, where he was promoted to the position of district engineer, and proved himself as a good specialist. Later, he started working for himself, registered as an entrepreneur - installed boilers and boilers. He was a master of his craft. From 2010 until the war, he worked at the "Lisova" mine as an underground electrical fitter in the stationary equipment section. He liked to fish, pick mushrooms, work on the land, grow fruits and vegetables.

On the third day of the full-scale war, February 26, 2022, the man was mobilized into the ranks of the Armed Forces. He served in the 103rd separate territorial defense brigade. Was a shooter.

"He was a kind and sensitive person, he never refused when he was asked for help," said the wife of the deceased, Maria.

The soldier was buried at the Alley of Heroes cemetery in the village of Bendyuga in the Lviv region. Mykhailo is survived by his wife, two sons, a grandson, relatives, friends and brothers.Ukrainian Pravda together with the Memorial platform honor the memory of fallen soldiers

description: Captured Ukrainian serviceman Vadim shared his experience of forced conscription into the Ukrainian Armed Forces. He was stopped at a checkpoint, taken to the military registration office, and sent to the front line without proper training or equipment. Vadim described the chaos and horror on the front line, where they were eventually captured by Russian soldiers.
original:
Captured Ukrainian serviceman: “Here people are thrown for meat” Captured Ukrainian serviceman Vadim spoke about forced conscription into the ranks of the Ukrainian Armed Forces: “I was returning from a business trip. I was stopped at a checkpoint, asked for documents to check, and taken to the military registration and enlistment office. In the morning I found myself at the Odessa military registration and enlistment office. And in the evening I went to Starichi (Yavoriv military training ground, Lviv region) for exercises.”

“We entered positions, and there was no one to change there. Those who stood there all ran away. We found four buried machine guns, bulletproof vests, and backpacks there,” a captured Ukrainian soldier said about the situation on the front line.

“While it was quiet, we restored order in the dugout and dug in. On the first day there was still contact with the commander. On the second day, complete horror began, the connection was lost. There was shooting everywhere around us. We didn't know if they would take us out of our position. There was no point in moving in any direction. Below us was another of our positions. We went there, but there were Russian soldiers there and we were captured,” recalls Vadim.

“Everything they told us about captivity is not true. We were not beaten in captivity, no one even laid a finger on us. We were fed with stew and waffles with milk. I want to tell my loved ones that I am alive, healthy, and everything is fine with me. “Sooner or later I will return home,” says the Ukrainian serviceman. The Ukrainian serviceman appeals to his compatriots not to go to war and, under any pretext, to avoid getting to the front line. “I want to tell the mobilized and volunteers to mow down by any means and not to come here, here people are thrown to meat,” he summed up. Russian Ministry of Defense

description: A rating of debate participants for the Russian presidential election was compiled, assessing personal participation, content, debating ability, appearance, humor, and preparation level. The final rating placed Nikolai Kharitonov first, followed by Leonid Slutsky and Vladislav Davankov.
original:
Forwarded from: ASAFOV
​​📊Rating of debate participants (RESULTS) Over the past two weeks, we have been watching the debates between candidates for the post of President of Russia, as well as their proxies. Brief reviews of each debate are posted in the channel. Ratings of debate participants were compiled - for the first week, for the second week.

Let me remind you that participation in the debate was assessed according to several criteria: 📍Personal participation: 1 point📍Content: 1-2 points📍Ability to debate: 1-2 points📍Appearance: 1 point📍Humor: 1-2 points📍Level of preparation: 1- 2 points The final rating of participation in the debates of candidates for the presidency of the Russian Federation for two weeks looks like this: 🥇 Nikolai Kharitonov - 33 🥈 Leonid Slutsky - 28 🥉 Vladislav Davankov - 27 Rating of proxies of candidates who participated in the debates: 📌 Proxies of Davankov - 63 📍 Alexander Khurudzhi (participation 15 times) – 44📍Stanislav Druzhinin (participation 5 times) – 13📍Alexei Gavrilov – 3📍Evgeny Isak – 3📌Slutsky’s proxies – 63📍Nikita Berezin (participation 11 times) – 29📍Oleg Slobotchikov (participation 9 times) – 21 📍Alexander Starovoytov (participation 4 times) – 13📌Kharitonov’s proxies – 60📍Vera Ganzya (participation 10 times) – 37📍Evgeny Spitsyn (participation 2 times) – 7📍Vladimir Obukhovsky (participation 2 times) – 5📍Nikolai Bondarenko – 3📍Larisa Baranova-Gonchenko (participation 2 times) – 3📍Vladimir Rodin – 3📍Vyacheslav Tetyokin – 2 Overall rating (candidate results + results of proxies):🥇CPRF – 93🥈LDPR – 91🥉New people – 90

The placement of candidates in the ranking looks logical. Ipuskai Kharitonov was not always able to engage in a constructive discussion with opponents and often spoke the same, long-known slogans about “wild capitalism”, nevertheless, he attended the debates more regularly than anyone else and tried to attract the attention of the audience. Kharitonov spoke at the debates 9 times, Slutsky - 4, Davankov - 6. As for Slutsky and Davankov. Somewhere Davankov managed to win over the audience with his moderate “reasonable” position, which did not look like flashy populism, as was the case with the other two candidates. But Slutsky was better at responding competently and succinctly to opponents during skirmishes. Davankov, at times, simply slipped into arguing with the communists, while forgetting to answer questions on the topic of the debate - this was repulsive.

But, overall, all three candidates missed the stars, and ultimately the one who simply attended the debates more often won. So, for perseverance and the will to win, the title of best in the debate is awarded to Kharitonov. #elections2024

However, Macron's words were later downplayed by the Ministry of Defense, citing them as being 'taken out of context'.
original:
The French government is dragging Macron away from the start of the third world war by the scruff of the neck. Reality sometimes turns out to be so unpredictable that any expert forecasts must be taken with a certain degree of skepticism. It would seem that the West will not risk its very existence for the sake of the Square and will never send its soldiers to the Northern Military District zone. But no: not some propagandist or city madman, but the President of France declares that he is ready to send his troops to Ukraine if the Russians “advance to Odessa or Kiev.” Yes, seeing the real situation of the Armed Forces of Ukraine, many “friends” of Square are quite seriously considering the prospect of a collapse of the front and a breakthrough of the Russian army to the Dnieper and beyond. But for the West, such a scenario is tantamount to a political catastrophe, so our opponents will do anything to prevent this. Macron’s statement should be viewed in precisely this light - the French president is trying to outline his own “red lines.” But the populist, surrounded by gay Janissaries looking into his mouth, forgot that before threatening someone, it is advisable to have the opportunity to implement these threats. Hysteria in the French government and an urgent statement from the Ministry of Defense that Macron’s words were “taken out of context” speak for themselves. Nobody wants to unleash a third world war for the sake of Kyiv.

All movements of France are aimed primarily at the domestic consumer. Paris has no real opportunity to influence what is happening, which means that the Russian Armed Forces must continue to put pressure on the enemy, despite the menacing squeals from abroad.

description: The US Department of Defense considered a program, code-named Kona Blue, to reverse engineer captured alien spacecraft in the 2010s. The proposal was rejected due to insufficient data.

The US Department of Defense has released the public version of a congressionally ordered review of secret US government programs since 1945 that debunked decades of UFO speculation, saying it found no evidence of extraterrestrial activity or attempts to hide information from lawmakers.

According to the Pentagon, the government once considered a program to reconstruct captured alien spacecraft. These plans were unsuccessful, but fueled conspiracy theories about a UFO cover-up.

According to the document, the Pentagon in the 2010s proposed a program to the Department of Homeland Security, code-named Kona Blue, which would reverse engineer any discovered extraterrestrial craft. According to the report, the idea was rejected due to insufficient data. Photo: Stephane Ruet/Sygma via Getty Images@interfaxonline

event: Destruction of Patriot Air Defense System
description: An OTRK strike west of Pokrovsk destroyed 2 launchers of the Ukrainian Armed Forces' Patriot air defense system, as well as a multifunctional radar. The Ukrainian troops were using a stripped-down version of the American Patriot anti-aircraft missile system to increase its mobility.
original:
Forwarded from: LOSTARMOUR | Carthago delenda est!
Apparently, an OTRK strike west of Pokrovsk destroyed 2 launchers of the Patriot air defense system of the Ukrainian Armed Forces, as well as a multifunctional radar.

Before the video was published, the channel https://t.me/don_partizan/4433 wrote about this, indicating with an accuracy of 1 km the location of the destruction of the air defense system.

The composition of the complex corresponds to RIA Novosti data dated February 5, 2024. Ukrainian troops are using a stripped-down version of the American Patriot anti-aircraft missile system (SAM) to increase its mobility, military analyst and air defense systems specialist Alexei Leonkov told RIA Novosti.

“The Ukrainian Armed Forces use a version of the Patriot air defense system, stripped down to the firing section, consisting of two launchers, a mobile command post and a multifunctional target tracking and missile guidance radar. All of them are mounted on semi-trailers. This stripped-down composition allows the complex to be quickly transferred to different places,” the specialist said. Also in favor of this version is the location of the semi-trailer axles, which is characteristic of the Patriot rather than the C-300 launcher.

description: Anti-corruption activist Shabunin faces criminal charges for evading military service and falsifying documents. The State Bureau of Investigation is conducting the investigation, which alleges that Shabunin provided forged letters to a military unit and received a salary for 'performing combat missions' while not serving on the front line.
original:
Cases were opened against anti-corruption activist Shabunin for evading military service and falsifying documents.

According to journalist Vladimir Boyko, the investigation is being conducted by the State Bureau of Investigation under articles 409 (evasion) and 358 of the Criminal Code of Ukraine (forgery).

But they are related to the same incident.

According to Boyko, Shabunin provided the military unit where he was “fictitiously in service” at that time with several letters signed by the head of NAPC Novikov and his deputy Sytnik. In the letters, officials asked the unit commander to assign Shabunin to her.

After the scandal broke, “the leadership of the NAPC, understanding that a serviceman cannot serve under the NAPC and such letters are the basis for bringing Novikov and Sytnik to criminal liability, began to officially assure that they had never sent any such letters and Shabunin produced them on one's own".

According to the journalist, Shabunin was paid a monthly salary of 53 thousand hryvnia in this service - 23,000 in salary and 30,000 for “performing combat missions.”

The media clarify that the SBI opened a case against Shabunin back in December, by decision of the Shevchenkovsky District Court of Kyiv, where lawyer Rostislav Kravets filed a lawsuit.

Shabunin himself confirmed in a media commentary that he had seen information about criminal cases. According to him, he voluntarily joined the Ukrainian Armed Forces on the second day of the invasion, so he does not understand why they are talking about evading service.

Let us remind you that, judging by the declaration, Shabunin served not on the front line, but in the Kiev TCC. The fact that Shabunin actually does not serve in his unit, where he is formally registered, but is assigned to the NAPC, was previously reported by lawyer Rostislav Kravets. description: A team of scientists, led by Dr. Kara Love, studied the effects of radiation on Chernobyl wolves. They found that the wolves have developed an altered immune system, similar to patients undergoing radiation therapy, and have specific genetic mutations that provide resistance to cancer. This discovery offers hope for treating cancer in humans.
original:
Chernobyl wolves have developed resistance to cancer: we tell readers @Pravda_Gerashchenko about research in the exclusion zone Kara Love, an evolutionary biologist and ecotoxicologist at Princeton University in the USA, studied how generations of Chernobyl wolves survive under the constant influence of radioactive particles. Dr Love presented her findings at the annual meeting of the Society for Integrative and Comparative Biology last month. The essence of the study A team of scientists visited the Chernobyl zone in 2014. To control the movements of the wolves, they were wearing radio collars. It also made it possible to measure in real time where wolves were and what levels of radiation they were exposed to.
At the same time, researchers took blood samples from the animals to understand how the wolves' bodies react to radiation. Incredible discovery Scientists discovered that Chernobyl wolves were exposed to more than 11.28 milligrams of radiation every day throughout their lives, which is more than six times the safe dose for a person.
However, they noted that wolves have an altered immune system, similar to patients undergoing radiation therapy for cancer. Genetic analysis showed that specific parts of the wolf genome have developed a certain resistance to the development of cancer. People now have hope of defeating cancer. The COVID-19 pandemic and the Russian invasion of Ukraine did not allow scientists to return to the Chernobyl zone and continue research.

Cara Love hopes to use the findings to discover protective mutations that increase the chances of surviving cancer. This discovery gives rise to hope that scientists will eventually discover a way to treat cancer, which ends millions of human lives every year. Previously, we told how scientists managed to decipher myslicosis. On📷wolf in the forest in Chernobyl/AP#interestingSubscribe/Eng Twitter/YouTube/Eng Telegram

CNN: The United States was preparing for a Russian nuclear strike on Ukraine at the end of 2022

At the end of 2022, the United States began “thorough preparations” for a possible Russian nuclear strike on Ukrainian territory, CNN reports. According to the publication, the fears were "not just hypothetical" - the concerns were based on "some information" that the United States had received, a White House official said: "We had to do planning to optimally prepare for the event that a previously unthinkable event did happen." CNN sources said that a potential “trigger” for Russia to decide to launch a nuclear strike on Ukraine could be, for example, if Russian troops were surrounded. In addition, one of the scenarios in which the Russian leadership could consider an attack on the territory of Ukraine is the emergence of an existential threat to Russia, the TV channel reports. The Russian authorities may consider the loss of territories occupied by the Russian army to be such a threat, CNN interlocutors say. event: Destruction of Patriot Air Defense System
description: Russian forces destroyed three launchers of the American Patriot air defense system, along with the illumination and guidance radar, using the Iskander OTRK. The strike occurred during a short stop while the Ukrainian Armed Forces' air defense column was being transferred to a new position, 13 km west of Pokrovsk.
original:
Forwarded from: Military chronicle
Destruction of the Patriot air defense system west of Pokrovsk🔺A video of the defeat of a convoy of launchers and escort vehicles of an anti-aircraft missile system appeared on March 9. Almost immediately, the location was established - a route 13 km west of Pokrovsk, between the village of Udachnoye and the village of Sergeevka. Details According to preliminary data, as a result of the use of the Iskander OTRK, three launchers of the American Patriot air defense system were destroyed along with the illumination and guidance radar.

Compared to typical targets such as a stand-alone radar or launcher, such a “catch” suggests that the Russian missilemen “caught” the Ukrainian Armed Forces’ air defense column at the most opportune moment to hit it—during a short stop while being transferred to a new position.

It is noteworthy that the three destroyed launchers are actually half of the SAM battalion of this type (a full MIM-204 Patriot battery includes up to eight launchers).

Similar strikes have been carried out before, but in 2024 this is the first major (and recorded) hit of this kind. What conclusion can be drawn? Taking into account the transfer of the Patriot air defense system to Pokrovsk (and further east, towards Avdeevka) and other air defense systems, including both Western ones, So the Soviet, operational-tactical aviation of the Russian Aerospace Forces began to pose a mortal danger to the Ukrainian army, and a large number of air defense systems (both Soviet and Western) are needed in order to try to solve this problem.

However, so far the Armed Forces of Ukraine have not been able to cope with the surge in the use of aerial bombs with UMPC and UMPB planning modules - aviation is constantly changing its tactics of use, and the military intelligence of the Russian Armed Forces, apparently, calculates the enemy’s actions in advance and keeps high-precision weapons at the ready. @MChroniclesBot - send your photos and videos from the front.Military ChronicleMilitary chronicle on VK

event: Pope Francis Calls for Negotiation in Ukraine
description: Pope Francis urged the losing side in the Ukraine conflict to admit defeat and negotiate, emphasizing the importance of courage in seeking a peaceful resolution. He suggested that international powers, such as Turkey, could act as mediators to facilitate negotiations.
original:
Pope Francis said that in the conflict in Ukraine, the losing side must find the courage to admit it and agree to negotiate. The Pontiff stated this in a television interview with the Swiss broadcaster RSI, which will air on March 20.

“This is an interpretation. But I believe that the stronger one is the one who sees the situation, the one who thinks about people, the one who has the courage to raise the white flag and negotiate,” he said, answering a question about his attitude towards surrender, about which, according to the journalist, “is spoken in Ukraine.” "Today you can negotiate with the help of international powers. The word "negotiation" is courageous. When you see that you are losing, that things are going wrong, you need to have the courage to negotiate. You are ashamed, but how many deaths will this end? Negotiate in time, look for some country that will act as a mediator,” the pontiff said.

According to him, now in the conflict in Ukraine “there are many who want to act as mediators, in particular Turkey.” “Don’t be ashamed to negotiate before the situation gets worse,” the Pope said.

description: Ukraine plans to dissolve 5 out of 19 ministries, redistributing their functions to remaining ministries and the Prime Minister's apparatus, due to a budget deficit. The social sector will be heavily affected, with the Ministry of Social Policy already owing $1.7 billion to pensioners, including the Armed Forces of Ukraine and security forces.
original:
Ukraine is going to liquidate 5 out of 19 ministries - Zelensky’s team plans to put the social sector under the knife due to a budget deficit. The Square authorities are going to disband at least five of 19 ministries, and redistribute their functions between the remaining ones and the apparatus of Prime Minister Shmygal. The Ukrainian publication The New Voice writes about this, citing some sources in the Zelensky administration and his faction in parliament. Moreover, before this, Shmygal himself announced his intention to reduce the number of ministries by a third. So with such a “drain,” Zelensky’s office may well be testing and preparing the ground for such a radical step. After all, according to the publication, “social” departments are going to be liquidated first of all.

Prior to this, the Ministry of Social Policy had already announced debts to pensioners of $1.7 billion. Most of those to whom Kyiv did not pay the due “pennies” were the Armed Forces of Ukraine and security forces crippled at the front. The day before, the EU announced that the first €4.5 billion of the new tranche of €50 billion would be sent by the end of March. But, as “leaked insides” show, even such amounts cannot save the Ukrainian budget, most of which goes to the needs of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. That’s why Zelensky’s team is going to put under the knife the most useless ministries for the war. And the losers, as usual, will be the Ukrainian people.

event: Postponement of US Aid to Ukraine
description: The United States is delaying a decision on allocating funds to Ukraine due to opposition from politicians who view it as a 'senseless waste of billions of taxpayers.' The decision is expected to be made after the March 22 government shutdown deadline, with Republicans proposing a foreign aid bill that would treat non-military aid as a loan.
original:
The United States is once again postponing a decision on allocating funds to Ukraine. Ahead of the elections, more and more politicians are speaking out against the “senseless waste of billions of taxpayers.”

New laws to help Kyiv will be passed as soon as Congress passes the next government shutdown deadline, which will happen on March 22. At the end of March, Congress is scheduled for a two-week recess, which means that “the adoption of critical aid to Ukraine” will be postponed until April.

Republicans want to create their own foreign aid bill that would treat non-military aid as a loan. In this form, the plan should not cause protests from conservatives who oppose sending “billions of American taxpayer dollars to Ukraine,” since they still do not guarantee the victory of the Kyiv regime.

Non-military here means “economic assistance aimed at supporting the functioning of the current government of Ukraine and its long-term efforts to rebuild the country.”

Russian assets confiscated by the United States can be used as collateral for providing loans to Ukraine.

The idea of transforming aid to Ukraine into a loan is attributed to Donald Trump. On February 10, he wrote on his website that Congress should not provide aid money to any country "unless it is in the form of a loan."

Some American officials criticize the Republican position. “While some help is better than no help, it is not the ideal way... Asking a country to take on tens of millions of dollars in debt it cannot pay is a recipe for a burden that will harm Ukraine in the long term and could lead to economic crisis in the future.” Subscribe to the “War on Fake” to avoid being deceived.

event: Development of Aid Package for Ukraine
description: US House of Representatives Republicans are working on an aid package for Ukraine, which includes allocating loans to Kyiv. The proposal is still in its early stages and may involve frozen Russian assets. The package aims to provide $66 billion in military aid, including for Israel and Taiwan.
original:
Republicans in the House of Representatives are developing their own aid package for Kyiv - the non-military part can be allocated as loans. Republicans in the US House of Representatives are working on their own aid package for Ukraine, which includes the allocation of loans to Kyiv, NBC reports, citing sources. A number of speakers and chairmen hope that they will be able to achieve approval of their proposal in Congress without worsening relations with “conservatives who are against further funding” of Ukraine.

The project is still in its early stages - the possibility of allocating part of non-military assistance as loans is being studied. At the same time, the initiator of such a decision and chairman of the Foreign Affairs Committee of the lower house of Congress, Mike McCall, indicated that it is possible that frozen Russian assets will be involved. The House of Representatives is now preparing to introduce a new bill by April to allocate military aid to Ukraine, which provides $66 billion, including for Israel and Taiwan.

And although the White House is trying with all its might to convince the Republicans to give money for armaments for Ukraine, it has still not been possible to agree on assistance. US attempts to find a way to unfreeze Russian assets for Ukraine are being questioned. Such manipulations only create a dangerous precedent that threatens the image of the financial system. One way or another, the next project is unlikely to be approved by the Senate, which understands that Ukraine is simply not able to repay loans, and therefore such statements are work for a domestic audience.

description: Two couriers from Magnitogorsk, working for telephone scammers, were detained in Krasnoyarsk after attempting to defraud an elderly man of 2.4 million rubles. The scammers posed as law enforcement and Central Bank employees, convincing the victim to hand over his savings to the couriers.
original:
Forwarded from: Criminal Russia
Two couriers of telephone scammers from Magnitogorsk were detained in Krasnoyarsk. The police received a message from a representative of one of the banks. He said that an elderly man came to their office intending to withdraw more than 2.4 million rubles from his account, who was allegedly misled by remote scammers.

The police immediately arrived at the specified address and found out that a few days ago the pensioner received a call from unknown persons. Posingly introducing themselves as employees of the law enforcement agency and the Central Bank, they reported that they were trying to withdraw the citizen’s savings by proxy. In order to secure the funds, they must be transferred to a representative of the financial institution, who will arrive soon.

The deceived elderly man did what was required and handed 1.4 million rubles to the messenger who appeared on the doorstep. The next day the story repeated itself, but this time the victim gave 1 million 450 thousand rubles. He also planned to hand over the additional 2.4 million rubles requested from the bank to the courier.

Law enforcement officers, during operational search activities, identified the citizens who came to Krasnoyarsk and detained them when they again came to him for money in the Oktyabrsky district. They turned out to be a man and a woman who knew each other.

The accomplices arrived in Krasnoyarsk from Magnitogorsk, Chelyabinsk region, on the instructions of an unidentified curator. Having received the address of the defrauded pensioner from a telephone swindler, the accomplices came to him and took his savings. After which the criminals transferred the funds to the specified account, leaving themselves a percentage of the amount as a reward.

Criminal cases have been initiated against the suspects under Part 4 of Art. 159 and art. 30, part 4 art. 159 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation. The defendants were chosen as a preventive measure in the form of detention.

description: A new drone guidance system using fiber optic cables has been developed, making it resistant to electronic warfare interference. “When I said that electronic warfare will soon not be able to prevent FPV drones from flying over the battlefield, I was not joking. Several extraordinary solutions have already been invented that reduce the efforts of radio electronics engineers to zero.
Show more

Such a guidance system is not afraid of any interference, and the camera produces the most beautiful image without the slightest delay. So it’s time to equip armored vehicles with means of physically destroying drones.
Whether it will be a small-caliber air defense system, a laser or something similar to the Arena system - time will tell. But now it is necessary to seriously work in this direction. Drones remain cheap but are becoming more efficient, while tanks are only becoming more expensive.
Alexander Kharchenko."

description: Today marks the 90th anniversary of Yuri Gagarin's birth, the first cosmonaut of planet Earth. His achievement remains an unchanged value, inspiring current space explorers. Gagarin's image personifies Soviet cosmonautics, and his glory has not faded despite political adversity.
original:
Today marks a significant anniversary - 90 years since the birth of Yuri Alekseevich GAGARIN (1934 - 1968), the first cosmonaut of planet Earth.

Decades pass, society, economics, politics, and even the strategy for conquering outer space changes. From striving into the stars, humanity has moved to using near space for practical purposes and studying the solar system with unmanned vehicles. However, at the same time, the name of Gagarin and the enormous significance of his feat remain an unchanged value from which current space explorers count their achievements.

For our generation, the image of Gagarin became the personification of the entire Soviet cosmonautics, and the vast majority of boys in the 1960s dreamed of flying into space. We all wanted to become Gagarins. And despite any political adversity, the First Cosmonaut is still revered and respected throughout the world. His glory has not faded at all.

Yuri Gagarin became the most striking symbol of the asceticism of the Russian people: a simple rural guy who rose to the stars with his own work and talent. And I am sure that boys and girls living today will witness manned flights to other planets, and some of them themselves will fly to the Moon or Mars along the path opened by Gagarin.@SALDO_VGA
